dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.path
Class AbstractPathTransformer

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.path.AbstractPathTransformer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ASPathTransformer, REPathTransformer, XPathTransformer
public abstract class AbstractPathTransformer
extends java.lang.Object

Base Implementation to do path transformations. A PathTransformer takes a match path and a replacement path like a regular expression engine. The match path is matched against a input path. If it matches the path is replaced by the replacement path. The replacement path may expand variables that take path fragments from the input path.

A match expression has the following form:

[ "/" ( <pathToken> | ( ( <literal>? "?" )+ <literal>? ) ]+

where "?" is a wildcard that matches all characters in a pathTokens and "/" is the path delimiter. wildcard and path delimiter can be overloaded by reimplementing doGetWildcard(), doGetDelimiter() and doMatch().

A replacement expression has the following form:

[ "/" <replacementToken> ]+

where replacementToken can contain variable references of the form "$" "{"? <varNo> "}"?. Variables are expanded by inserting the characters matched by literals of the match-string. Variable 0 matches the first wildcard, variables 1 the second and so on. The variable prefix "$" can be exchanged by subclassing this class and reimplementing doGetVariablePrefix(). The pathToken by which the variable is replaced can be patched by overloading the method doTransformVariableValue().

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.a

doGetDelimiter

protected java.lang.String doGetDelimiter()
Provides the path delimiter which defines the boundaries at which paths are split into tokens. The value is interpreted as a regexp.

This method can be overridden in sub-classes.

Returns:
The delimiter between path tokens (defaults to "/")
Since:
2008.a

doMatch

protected boolean doMatch(java.lang.String matchToken,
                          java.lang.String pathToken,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> variables)
Checks if a path-token matches a match-token. If the match-token contains wildcards the substrings of the path-token that match the wildcards must be appended to the list of variables. Each wildcard produces a new variables. variables must be added from left to right.

This method can be overridden in sub-classes.

Parameters:
matchToken - The token from the match string
pathToken - The token from the path
variables - The variables to be filled with the strings matched by wildcards (maqy be null)
Returns:
true if the token of the path matches the corresponding token from the match string
Since:
2008.a

doGetWildcard

protected java.lang.String doGetWildcard()
This string is a wildcard for the match string. The wildcard is used by doMatch to match every character of a path token with a simple greedy match algorithm.

This method can be overridden in sub-classes.

Returns:
The wildcard string
Since:
2008.a

doGetVariablePrefix

protected java.lang.String doGetVariablePrefix()
The string that marks the beginning of a variable. Variable syntax: <prefix> "{" <variable-no > "}". Defaults to "$"

This method can be overridden in sub-classes.

Returns:
The prefix string that marks a variable in the replacement string.
Since:
2008.a

doTransformVariableValue

protected java.lang.String doTransformVariableValue(int varNo,
                                                    java.lang.String variableValue)
                                             throws CtxtException
This method can be used to patch a variable value before it is pasted to the output path This default implementation does no transformation.

This method can be overridden in sub-classes.

Parameters:
varNo - The number of the variable
variableValue - The variable value
Returns:
The transformed variable value
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a
